metadata.title: USN-6983-1 -- FFmpeg vulnerability
metadata.description: Zeng Yunxiang discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled memory during video encoding. An attacker could possibly use this issue to perform a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6983-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  ffmpeg - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 ffmpeg-doc - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavcodec-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavdevice-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavfilter-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavformat-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavformat57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavresample-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavresample3 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavutil-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libavutil55 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libpostproc-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libswresample-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libswresample2 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libswscale-dev - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 libswscale4 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm6 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
